page.title: #nice
page.para: There is an online discussion channel dedicated to the Nice programming language, since June 15th 2003. The developers often meet there to discuss about the implementation, or about new features. Users are welcome too. So pop by and be our guests! (Most developers are currently from Europe, and we are there during the day or the evening).
The channel (two of these are probably robots).
To participate, you will need an IRC client. Set it up to connect to the server irc.freenode.net. Then /join #nice. In some web-browsers, you can simply follow this link.
Freenode, the server that hosts the channel, is a special IRC server. For instance, you can register your identity, and protect it by a password. For more information, see the freenode website.
Archives of the IRC discussions are available.
